body: It's not an overall speed but an average speed over the last 5 minutes. The individual speeds is at that exact moment. If your transfer speeds wildly fluctuate as yours appear to be doing then the differences you highlight are to be expected.
This is why I asked to also use average speeds for individual speeds for better ETAs and better information.
well I guess 'better' is subjective. No program I use [winscp, filezilla, chrome, windows transfers as examples] average the speed of individual file copy speeds.

That is true, but I think an ETA should not be calculated based on such unreliable data.

And since this program only displays speed in certain intervalls an average speed would make sense here.
Assuming these are big files (> 8MB) then #968 will fix this problem.

issue.title: drive: fix stats when doing chunked upload

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Fix accounting of upload chunks in drive the same way as was done in ACD with AccountPart etc.

See also: #970

repository.name: rclone

issue.body:
used in Onedrive to display accurate speed.

I only used the implemented Reader in Onedrive, but this could potentially fix #968 and #970 and could probably be used with other endpoints

issue.title: Incredibly slow gdrive speed - Web upload fast

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When filing an issue, please include the following information if possible as well as a description of the problem.  Make sure you test with the latest beta of rclone.

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    https://rclone.org/downloads/

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the [rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) instead of filing an issue.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
Latest(downloaded as of 20 minutes ago)

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows server 2012
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google drive
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
Ccopy --ignore-existing --checksum --ignore-size --verbose --transfers 15 --checkers 9 --contimeout 60s --timeout 300s --retries 3 --low-level-retries 10 --stats 1s
> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Transfering 2 roughly 2gig files results in this;
http://i.imgur.com/OEBcs6k.png

I dont get it, uploading via web panel is fast. It will eventually crawl to 1kbps after a while, making it impossible for me to use rclone now, i didnt used to act like this. Anyone else ever experienced this?

body:
Here's a fresh beta with this fixed, give it a try:
https://www.breunig.xyz/share/rclone-beta/v1.36-232-gb2b5c629-drive-accounting%CE%B2/

This makes the reported upload speeds for individual files much more accurate. It's still a bit off from the reported global speed, but I guess that's either due to rounding or timing issues. In any case, it's now definitely in the same ball park, unlike before. Turned out this was really easy to fix, too, thanks to @yonjah's work.

issue.title: --bwlimit ignored for chunked uploads on b2 & drive (& others?)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When filing an issue, please include the following information if possible as well as a description of the problem.  Make sure you test with the latest beta of rclone.

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    https://rclone.org/downloads/

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the [rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) instead of filing an issue.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.36

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 16.04 x64

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Backblaze B2

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone sync -vv --bwlimit 350k --transfers 1 /path/to/files b2-crypt-remote:

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Transferred:   272.562 MBytes (258.207 kBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:               101
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:     18m0.9s
Transferring:
 * ...large-file.ext:  1% done, 350.138 kBytes/s, ETA: 13h20m28s

2017/05/25 10:22:16 DEBUG : 405bo5jvqamhb26j3onqq0jj4k/io7s5pcc5bhbe7ag1dk09s5hpk/qt3tqkjokrm354a7vj755norv49hcb9215qe0o4jogsnbes50i2g/c52hpqov41uq2aehm0jg9tjm2pchh0bmfeia7bsgbg5lj7ppj8gg: Sending chunk 3 length 100663296
2017/05/25 10:22:16 DEBUG : 405bo5jvqamhb26j3onqq0jj4k/io7s5pcc5bhbe7ag1dk09s5hpk/qt3tqkjokrm354a7vj755norv49hcb9215qe0o4jogsnbes50i2g/c52hpqov41uq2aehm0jg9tjm2pchh0bmfeia7bsgbg5lj7ppj8gg: Didn't find object to account part transfer

Even though rclone says it's only using ~350k, several other bandwidth monitoring utilities show that it's maxing out my upload speed, harming connectivity for other devices and services on my network. (350k is roughly half my upload speed which worked fine with Amazon Cloud Drive)

It's also possible that it matches the bandwidth limit flag at some times, but not at others which may explain the discrepancy in the log. I tried to find an excerpt around the time I noticed issues,
